item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Tuesday, November 19, 2024 at 2:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. OpenStreetMap's New Vector Tiles (94 points | 19 comments)
2. Austen and Darwin converged on the question of beauty (3 points | discuss)
3. Show HN: Embed an SQLite database in your PostgreSQL table (30 points | 16 comments)
4. Launch HN: Regatta Storage (YC F24) – Turn S3 into a local-like, POSIX cloud FS (480 points | 245 comments)
5. Rim/Blackberry tales – reply all (55 points | 18 comments)
6. A Woman Who Defined the Great Depression (11 points | 2 comments)
7. Show HN: FastGraphRAG – Better RAG using good old PageRank (355 points | 88 comments)
8. Expand.ai (YC S24) Is Hiring a Founding Engineer to Turn the Web into an API ( | hide)
9. Maslow 4: Large format CNC routing made accessible (169 points | 45 comments)
10. 20 years of Google Scholar (343 points | 148 comments)
11. Scientific American's departing editor and the politicization of science (188 points | 231 comments)
12. Two undersea cables in Baltic Sea disrupted (363 points | 615 comments)
13. Hyperfine: A command-line benchmarking tool (167 points | 30 comments)
14. DOJ will push Google to sell off Chrome (758 points | 869 comments)
15. MailCatcher runs a super simple SMTP server (252 points | 77 comments)
16. Batched reward model inference and Best-of-N sampling (23 points | discuss)
17. Sequin: A powerful little tool for inspecting ANSI escape sequences (71 points | 24 comments)
18. Museum of Bad Art (181 points | 131 comments)
19. A BBC navigation bar component broke depending on the external monitor (267 points | 110 comments)
20. Air traffic failure caused by two locations 3600nm apart sharing 3-letter code (237 points | 240 comments)
21. The tragedy of running an old Node project (140 points | 202 comments)
22. The Skyline algorithm for packing 2D rectangles (201 points | 48 comments)
23. Hyrumtoken: A Go package to encrypt pagination tokens (63 points | 39 comments)
24. Listen to what gets lost when an MP3 is made (2015) (110 points | 62 comments)
25. Show HN: Dumbo – Hono inspired framework for PHP (62 points | 50 comments)
26. Iumenta: A generic framework for animal digital twins (20 points | 8 comments)
27. Show HN: Tips.io – A Tailwind playground with AI, page management, and theming (254 points | 59 comments)
28. Waiting for many things at once with io_uring (100 points | 24 comments)
29. Histogramming Bytes with Positional Popcount (39 points | discuss)
30. AAA Linux Gaming on ARM64 Mac Hardware, Now a Reality (7 points | 1 comment)
